title: As pet adoptions soar, this dog toy company is thriving
description: When business slowed early in the pandemic, West Paw made masks for hospitals. Now, the company is back to its core business of making recyclable dog toys as demand rises.

title: Jake Tapper issues warning before playing soundbite from Trump rally
description: CNN's Jake Tapper debunks President Trump's false and misleading statement about wearing masks.

title: Elite investors accessing Trump briefings is everything that's wrong with the stock market
description: Accurate information can be incredibly valuable to investors, especially in the midst of a confusing health crisis threatening the American economy. Unfortunately, access to that kind of intel is unequal.

title: Herd immunity is not the way out of pandemic, experts warn
description: Much of the US continues to report an upward trend in coronavirus cases, with 59,494 new cases reported nationwide on Wednesday alone, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

title: How QAnon uses religion to lure unsuspecting Christians
description: Parker Neff was scrolling through conservative posts on Facebook when he saw an unfamiliar hashtag: #WWG1WGA.

title: Two of Europe's biggest capitals are in trouble as Covid-19 cases surge
Paris and London impose new restrictions to combat a worrying spread of Covid-19
description:
• Herd immunity is not the way out of pandemic, experts warn
• Hong Kong and Singapore to set up a 'travel bubble' as Covid cases fall
• LIVE UPDATES: Germany just recorded a daily high number of new Covid-19 cases

title: How mail-in ballot rule chaos in North Carolina is hurting Black voters
description: Almost 1,000 absentee ballots are sitting in a locked bin somewhere in the Guilford County Board of Elections waiting to be processed.

title: Analysis: Once again, Trump's diagnosis dominates campaign
description: Americans heard more about President Donald Trump's contracting the novel coronavirus than anything else about him for the second week in a row, and this week, the numbers citing coronavirus were significantly higher than in any week since July.

title: Conor McGregor says he's accepted a new UFC fight
description: Conor McGregor has said that he has accepted a fight against Dustin Poirier.

title: Biden campaign halts Kamala Harris' travel after two people test positive for coronavirus
description: Joe Biden's campaign is halting the travel of his running mate, California Sen. Kamala Harris, through this weekend after two people -- a flight crew member and Harris' communications director, Liz Allen -- tested positive for coronavirus.

title: Finnair is selling its airplane food in grocery stores
description: What do you miss most about air travel? Is it the thrill of the take off? The excitement of stepping off the aircraft and arriving in a new country?

title: More Nigerian protests against police brutality as reforms fail to convince
description: Nigerian protesters demanding an end to police brutality returned to the streets on Wednesday, saying they were unconvinced by the creation of a new police unit and a pledge not to use violence against demonstrators.

title: Uber launches medicines delivery service in South Africa
description: Uber Eats' South African unit on Thursday expanded delivery offerings, launching an app-based over-the-counter medicines service as it seeks to claw market share in the fast-growing online shopping sector in Africa's most industrialized economy.

title: Sharon Stone says she's 'had it' with dating
description: Sharon Stone has revealed that she's "done" with dating, and is instead focusing on spending more time with her friends and family.

title: Analysis: Trump argues pandemic is over to avoid accountability
description: President Donald Trump's refusal to tell America the truth about the pandemic in a bid to save his political skin, on display at a potential super-spreader rally in Iowa on Wednesday night, is fostering a vacuum in national leadership and crucial public health mobilization as a winter of sickness and death looms.

title: Avlon: This is just another of the President's 20,000 lies
description: CNN's John Avlon criticizes President Trump following a Washington Post story which reports an "unmasking" probe commissioned by the Department of Justice concluded without charges or a public report.

title: This electric car maker's stock is up 1,000% since March
description: China's wannabe "Tesla killer" is on a wild ride.

title: How to get the iPhone 12 for free -- really
description: The release of the eagerly anticipated iPhone 12 (and its siblings) is just about here.

title: These countries are cashing in on borrowing
description: The world is going to exit the coronavirus crisis with huge piles of debt.

title: NBC's Trump town hall will likely be a train wreck — and viewers will flock to it
description: What's worse: no presidential debate at all or separate and unequal events staged at exactly the same time with a media outlet putting both thumbs on the scale to favor one candidate over the other?

title: Cows 'prefer to co-moo-nicate in person'
description: Cows don't make video calls but if they did, chances are they'd hate them just as much as most of us do.

title: The parts of America cut off by the pandemic
description: Each evening, Point Roberts residents Steve Work and Shawna Sylvester head out for a walk. Strolling along the sandy beaches that surround the community, Work says it often feels like the American/Canadian couple has the eight miles of shoreline to themselves.

title: Kyrgyzstan president Jeenbekov resigns after unrest
description: Kyrgyz President Sooronbai Jeenbekov resigned on Thursday after days of unrest following a disputed election, saying he wanted to prevent clashes between security forces and protesters who have demanded his removal from office.

title: Italian police break up counterfeit wine ring
description: Italian police have broken up a ring producing counterfeit Sassicaia wine, a variety considered among the finest in the world that sells for hundreds of euros a bottle, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo watches on television as Portugal defeats Sweden 3-0
description: No Ronaldo? No problem.

title: Lockdown or a drip of Covid restrictions? One path is better for economy
description: Governments across Europe are choosing between two vastly different strategies as a second wave of Covid-19 arrives in force. Most are imposing limited local restrictions and keeping their economies open. But in the UK and Ireland, scientific advisers have pushed for second national lockdowns, despite fears of an economic shock.

title: Global stocks slide on Covid-19 fears
description: Global stock markets and US futures retreated on Thursday as a second wave of coronavirus cases triggered more restrictions in Europe and negotiations in Washington over financial help for struggling workers and businesses remained deadlocked.

title: What is herd immunity? Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains
description: A vaccine is still the best way to bring an end to the Covid-19 pandemic, health experts say, adding that pursuing herd immunity would be a dangerous strategy. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains.

title: Thailand announces emergency decree to quell pro-democracy protests
description: Thailand's government arrested several prominent protest leaders and announced a ban on gatherings of more than five people under an emergency decree Thursday aimed at quelling pro-democracy demonstrations that have gripped the country for more than three months.

title: 'Big pieces' of Kilimanjaro 'missing' due to climate crisis, says ice climber Will Gadd
description: Will Gadd has witnessed at close hand the destruction being wrought by the climate crisis.

title: BTS made Big Hit a huge success. They're also why its IPO is so risky
description: The music label behind the planet's biggest K-pop sensation has parlayed that success into a multimillion-dollar share issue.

title: Covid-19 is killing restaurants. So why is Michelin still obsessing about star ratings?
description: Walk into almost any fine dining kitchen and the chances are its chefs would say there's only one holy grail of achievement in their profession: to be awarded a Michelin star.

title: A massive animal migration is still happening in the Maasai Mara. But the pandemic means few can see it
description: For Nadutari Tingisha, making beaded jewelry is the only job she's ever known. "Beading is something we grew up doing, so we will never give up on it," she says.

title: Billboard pointing to Trump rally says 'superspreader event this way.' (Literally.)
description: CNN's Erin Burnett discusses President Trump holding rallies with thousands of supports packed together with few masks despite the coronavirus pandemic and the herd immunity proposal Trump is touting.

title: Rare copy of Shakespeare's First Folio sells for record $10M
description: A rare copy of Shakespeare's First Folio sold for almost $10 million Wednesday, becoming the most expensive work of literature ever to appear at auction, according to Christie's.

title: Chinese President Xi Jingping coughed, and critics seized the opportunity
description: During a speech in Shenzhen on Wednesday to promote the continued development of China's first special economic zone, Chinese President Xi Jinping coughed -- a lot.

title: Trump rally goer: If I'm gonna get sick and die, I guess it's my turn
description: CNN's Jim Acosta spoke to rally goers on their thoughts about coronavirus ahead of President Donald Trump's MAGA rally in Des Moines, Iowa.

title: Obama: Trump's lack of 'patience' and 'focus' hold back his foreign policy
description: Former President Barack Obama said Wednesday that President Donald Trump lacks the needed "patience" and "focus" to make substantial changes to American foreign policy, previewing a possible attack line as the former President prepares to return to the campaign trail for Democratic nominee Joe Biden.

title: Chris Cuomo responds to Trump's handling of family diagnosis
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo reacts to President Donald Trump's handling of the coronavirus pandemic and response to his family being diagnosed with Covid-19.

title: Mother of 7-year-old with autism files lawsuit after officer handcuffed him at school
description: The mother of a North Carolina boy with autism has filed a lawsuit after a school resource officer handcuffed and held her 7-year-old son on the ground during a 2018 incident at an alternative school in Statesville.
